noun.definition: The ability to do something that frightens one.
noun.example: She called on all her courage to face the ordeal.

noun.definition: Strength in the face of pain or grief.
noun.example: He fought his illness with great courage.

verb.definition: Give support, confidence, or hope to (someone).
verb.example: We were encouraged by the success of this venture.

verb.definition: Persuade (someone) to do or continue to do something by giving support and advice.

usage_examples: It takes courage to admit you were wrong.
The soldiers fought with great courage.
